This might be the case the the content is a empty string (see bug 45771). But 
I definitly had a valid selection at the time pressing ctrl+c in the Java 
editor.

After such an exception a dialo pops up that suggests closing of Eclipse.

The stack trace looks the same however the message is generated whenever the 
setting of the clipboard content failed.

Veronika, can you please comment on when this can happen ?

Martin, we should protect the action against the error 
ERROR_CANNOT_SET_CLIPBOARD and should show a dialog to the user. Would be nice 
for RC1, but we can do it in RC2 as well.

I just saw at other places that set the clipboard that this is common 
unexpected behaviour of platforms. The chosen sulution is to ask the user to 
try again.

> 20040526
verified in source - unable to reproduce.
